Package Menu_package

Class CSVHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • Menu_package.CSVHandler
  • public class CSVHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles all proccesses that relating to the csv file provided (with information of all Menu Items and Set) This class reads and creates Items objects from the csv file. It also edits the csv file itself when Items needs to be added or deleted permanently.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      CSVHandler()
      Constructor for this class

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addItemToCSV​(Item item, java.lang.String path, java.lang.String friendLine)
      Add an Item into the csv file (that contains information of all Menu Items and Set), where it will be added above the first Item, that has the same Item Type as the Item to be added.
      Item createItem​(java.lang.String csvLine)
      Creates and returns an Item object, with attributes information extracted from a single row, from the csv file provided (with information of all Menu Items and Set)
      void removeItemFromCSV​(java.lang.String path, java.lang.String lineToDelete)
      Remove an Item (by its name) from the csv file (that contains information of all Menu Items and Set), by removing the line that contains the Item's name (specified by the parameter).
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitDescription​(java.lang.String descriptionString, java.lang.String type)
      Creates and returns ArrayList of String, where each String represents a part of an Item description.

    • Method Detail

      • createItem

        public Item createItem​(java.lang.String csvLine)
        Creates and returns an Item object, with attributes information extracted from a single row, from the csv file provided (with information of all Menu Items and Set)
        Parameters:
        csvLine - String representing the single row in the csv file, where values are separated by commas
        Returns:
        Item New Item object, created using the single row in the csv file

      • removeItemFromCSV

        public void removeItemFromCSV​(java.lang.String path,
                              java.lang.String lineToDelete)
        Remove an Item (by its name) from the csv file (that contains information of all Menu Items and Set), by removing the line that contains the Item's name (specified by the parameter).
        Parameters:
        path - Path to the csv file that contains information of all Menu Items and Set.
        lineToDelete - Item name of Item to be deleted.

      • addItemToCSV

        public void addItemToCSV​(Item item,
                         java.lang.String path,
                         java.lang.String friendLine)
        Add an Item into the csv file (that contains information of all Menu Items and Set), where it will be added above the first Item, that has the same Item Type as the Item to be added.
        Parameters:
        item - Item to be added
        path - Path to the csv file that contains information of all Menu Items and Set
        friendLine - Item name of the first Item, that has the same Item Type as the Item to be added.

      • splitDescription

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> splitDescription​(java.lang.String descriptionString,
                                                              java.lang.String type)
        Creates and returns ArrayList of String, where each String represents a part of an Item description. The ArrayList is created by splitting the String that contains the description of the Item. If the description comes from an Item under the Set category, the description String is splitted into 7 parts. 1st to 6th parts are Item name and description from Appetiser, Main Course, Dessert respectively, and 7th part is the Item name of drink Item. There is no description for Items in Drink category as its name is self-explanatory. Hence, ArrayList size for an Item under Set Category is always fixed. If the description comes from an Item not under the Set category, the description String is splitted by " + ". Unlike the Item under the Set Category, the description ArrayList Size of the Item is not fixed. It can have any size, i.e. description can have 6 parts, 1 parts, etc
        Parameters:
        descriptionString - String that contains the description of the Item
        type - Item Type of the described Item
        Returns:
        ArrayList of String ArrayList of String, where each String represents a part of an Item description.
